Sentence.sentence: When the molten rock of the earth’s core forced its way to the surface to form the throat of a volcano, as the centuries passed, the rock cooled and hardened, shrinkingand cracking into long columns.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: The legend says that when seven girls were attacked by bears, they took refuge on top of a small rock, and they appealed to the Rock God for help.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: The God caused the rock to grow and to lift the girls far above the ground, while its sides were scored by the claws of the angry bears.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Rising more than 1,000 feet in the middle of the gently rolling plains of Wyoming, the massive column of rock looks as though it was dropped down into this location from a different time and place.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Its sheer rock sides sweep up from a broad base until they cut off abruptly at the flat summit.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Even today, says the legend, the girls can be seen above the towering rock as seven shining stars in the night sky.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Two world wars and a Great Depression rocked the confidence of many people that scientific expertise alone could create a prosperous and ordered world.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Your rock band has never sounded better.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: The rock band needs more hours of practice
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: The rock band is going to play here for a month.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Rock stars now face a new hazard --- voice abuse.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: What does last week's announcement say about rock star, Phil Collins
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: It sits firmly on solid rock at the bottom of the ocean.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Indeed, nowadays most people like to listen to pop and rock music.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: Probing the rock pools of a local beach or practising French on a language exchange can fire children's passions, boost their skills and open their eyes to life's possibilities.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: rising more than 1, 000 feet in the middle of the gently rolling plains of Wyoming, the massive column of rock looks as though it was dropped down into this location from a different time and place.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The Queensland rock violet is one of the best studied resurrection plants so far, with a draft genome(基因图谱) published last year by a Chinese team.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: They lack water-storing structures, and their existence on rock faces prevents them from tapping groundwater, so they have instead developed the ability to change their metabolism.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: We don't have any rock and roll.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: When the molten rock of the earth's core forced its way to the surface to form the throat of a volcano, as the centuries passed, the rock cooled and hardened, shrinking and cracking into long columns.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section B

means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 罗克地貌名称，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“岩石”(rock)
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 罗克地貌名称，来源于中世纪英语atter oke(at the oak)的误分音节
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 罗克职业名称，毛纺工人，或卷线杆制作者，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“卷线杆”(distaff)
[地名] [美国] 罗克

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"摇动"之意。
means: rock ： 多指猛烈地摇动或摇晃。
sway ： 主要指树枝等的来回摇动。
swing ： 指有规律地前后、上下摆动，也可指不停地转动。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"石，石头"之意。
means: rock ： 普通用词，指构成地表最坚硬部分或突出于周围地面的巨大岩石，也可指石头或石块。
stone ： 普通用词，泛指井然的或经加工的各类石头，可大可小。
gravel ： 集合名词，常指用于铺路的小石子和沙砾。
pebble ： 多指海边、河边或沙中圆形的小卵石。

word_mean: 组成地壳的天然矿物集合体。
孤立突出于海底的岩石或珊瑚遗体，船舶航行最危险的天然障碍物。

Sentence.sentence: A birdwatcher, armed with a telescope, found the pet sitting desperately on a rock.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语陕西卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Above 4, 000 meters is the highland desert: gravel (砾石), stones and rocks.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语全国卷I 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: But a new study suggests they used a little rock 'n' roll.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语四川卷 阅读理解 阅读E 原文

Sentence.sentence: I got my next lesson from rock climbing.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读E 原文

Sentence.sentence: If you studied pictures that ancient people left on rock walls and you tried to determine their meaning, you would not detect a deep interest in romance among the artists.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Learn rock climbing and work as a team, and enjoy the great outdoor environment.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: Many rock bands were able to follow in the footsteps of the beatles.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语浙江卷 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: Next, cover the hole with the plastic sheet, securing the edges of the plastic with dirt and weighting the sheet's center down with a rock.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语全国卷1 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Often there are rocks or branches hidden in the water.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语浙江卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: People have long puzzled over how the Egyptians moved such huge rocks.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语四川卷 阅读理解 阅读E 原文

Sentence.sentence: Rani, my faceless agent whom I'd never met in person, got me rock-bottom prices on airfares, cars, and hotels.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语全国卷2 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Rock music consists of many different styles.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语浙江卷 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: Rock music developed in the 1950s and the early 1960s.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语浙江卷 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: The pony had actually been trapped between two rocks.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖北卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: Their victory in America was still remembered as a major turning point in the history of Rock and Roll.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语浙江卷 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: Then she ran along the edge of cliff and fell 100 feet, bouncing off a rock into the sea.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语陕西卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: To construct a working still, use a sharp stick or rock to dig a hole four feet across and three feet deep.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语全国卷1 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: When/if it cried, she rocked it back and forth and gave it little comforting pats, the mother continued to care for the young panda for more than two years.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语四川卷 语法填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: If you've explored the area before, keep an eye out for familiar sights—you may be surprised how quickly identifying a distinctive rock or tree can restore your bearings.
Sentence.come: 2019年考研真题（英语一）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

sentences.en: To build this tunnel we had to cut through the solid rock.
sentences.cn: 为了修建这条隧道, 我们必须凿开坚硬的岩石。

means.word_mean: 岩块, 石块; 礁; 暗礁

sentences.en: The ship came close to the rocks and then sheered away.
sentences.cn: 这条船驶近岩礁, 然后迅速转向避开。

sentences.en: There's danger from falling rocks.
sentences.cn: 这里有石块儿崩落的危险。

sentences.en: He lifted the rock without effort.
sentences.cn: 他毫不费力地举起了那块石头。

sentences.en: That boy threw rocks at me.
sentences.cn: 那个男孩向我扔石子。

sentences.en: She likes rock music.
sentences.cn: 她喜爱摇滚乐。

sentences.en: The trees rocked in the wind.
sentences.cn: 树在风中摇摆。

sentences.en: The movement of the ship rocked us to sleep.
sentences.cn: 船的摇晃使我们进入了梦乡。

sentences.en: His sudden death rocked the village.
sentences.cn: 他的突然死亡震惊了全村。</seg>

phrase.cizu_name: on the rocks informal 非正式

jx.jx_en_mean: (of a relationship or enterprise) experiencing difficulties and likely to fail
jx.jx_cn_mean: （关系）濒于破裂的；濒临毁灭的；完蛋；（企业）遇经济困难的；（濒于）破产的

jx.jx_en_mean: (of a drink) served undiluted and with ice cubes

jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)如痴如狂地奏摇滚乐

phrase.cizu_name: between a rock and a hard place

jx.jx_en_mean: Confronted with equally unpleasant alternatives and few or no opportunities to evade or circumvent them.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 面临同样令人不愉快的几乎没有机会逃避或克服的选择

jx.jx_en_mean: In a state of difficulty, destruction, or ruin
jx.jx_cn_mean: 处于困难境、濒临毁灭或完蛋地

lj.lj_ly: Their marriage is on the rocks.
Our accountant says the business is on the rocks.
lj.lj_ls: 我们的会计师说生意濒临破产
加冰块的苏格兰威士忌酒

jx.jx_en_mean: To disturb the balance or routine of a situation

lj.lj_ly: He has an easygoing managerial style and won't rock the boat unless absolutely necessary.
lj.lj_ls: 他有一套很随意的经营作风，除非极有必要否则不会改变自己一惯的做法

entry.def: Rock is the hard substance which the Earth is made of.

example.ex: The hills above the valley are bare rock...
example.tran: 山谷上方的小山全是光秃秃的石头。

example.ex: A little way below the ridge was an outcrop of rock that made a rough shelter.
example.tran: 山脊下方不远处有一块露出地面的岩石，大致形成了一个掩蔽处。

entry.def: A rock is a large piece of rock that sticks up out of the ground or the sea, or that has broken away from a mountain or a cliff.

example.ex: She sat cross-legged on the rock.
example.tran: 她盘腿坐在那块巨大的岩石上。

example.ex: ...the sound of the sea crashing against the rocks...

entry.def: A rock is a piece of rock that is small enough for you to pick up.

example.ex: She bent down, picked up a rock and threw it into the trees.
example.tran: 她弯腰捡起一块石子，扔进了树丛中。

entry.def: When something rocks or when you rock it, it moves slowly and regularly backwards and forwards or from side to side.

example.ex: His body rocked from side to side with the train...
example.tran: 他的身体随着火车左右摇晃。

example.ex: He stood a few moments, rocking back and forwards on his heels...
example.tran: 他站了一会儿，踮着脚跟前后摇晃。

entry.def: If an explosion or an earthquake rocks a building or an area, it causes the building or area to shake. You can also say that the building or area rocks.

example.ex: Three people were injured yesterday when an explosion rocked one of Britain's best known film studios...
example.tran: 昨天，一起爆炸使得英国最著名的电影制片厂之一发生强烈震动，导致3人受伤。

example.ex: ...a country that's rocked by dozens of earthquakes every year...
example.tran: 每年遭受十几次地震袭击的国家

entry.def: If an event or a piece of news rocks a group or society, it shocks them or makes them feel less secure.

example.ex: His death rocked the fashion business.
example.tran: 他的去世震惊了整个时装界。

example.ex: ...the latest scandal to rock the monarchy...
example.tran: 震惊了整个王国的最新丑闻

entry.def: Rock is loud music with a strong beat that is usually played and sung by a small group of people using instruments such as electric guitars and drums.

example.ex: He once told an interviewer that he didn't even like rock music.
example.tran: 他曾告诉一位采访者，他甚至都不喜欢摇滚乐。

entry.def: Rock is a sweet that is made in long, hard sticks and is often sold in towns by the sea in Britain.
entry.tran: （常在英国海滨城镇销售的）棒形硬糖

entry.def: If you are caught between a rock and a hard place, you are in a difficult situation where you have to choose between two equally unpleasant courses of action.
If you have an alcoholic drink such as whisky on the rocks, you have it with ice cubes in it.

example.tran: 加冰块的苏格兰威士忌

entry.def: If something such as a marriage or a business is on the rocks, it is experiencing very severe difficulties and looks likely to end very soon.
entry.tran: （婚姻）濒临破裂;（企业等）濒临失败;岌岌可危

example.ex: She confided to her mother six months ago that her marriage was on the rocks...
example.tran: 6个月前，她向母亲透露自己的婚姻已经岌岌可危。

example.ex: Our film industry is on the rocks.
example.tran: 我们的电影业困难重重。

means.word_mean: 1. a lump or mass of hard consolidated mineral matter;
2. material consisting of the aggregate of minerals like those making up the Earth's crust;

sentences.sentence: "stone is abundant in New England and there are many quarries"

means.word_mean: 3. (figurative) someone who is strong and stable and dependable;

sentences.sentence: "he was her rock during the crisis"
"Thou art Peter, and upon this rock I will build my church"--Gospel According to Matthew

means.word_mean: 4. hard stick bright-colored stick candy typically peppermint flavored
5. a genre of popular music originating in the 1950s; a blend of Black rhythm-and-blues with White country-and-western;

sentences.sentence: "rock is a generic term for the range of styles that evolved out of rock'n'roll."

means.word_mean: 1. move back and forth or sideways;

sentences.sentence: "She rocked back and forth on her feet"

means.word_mean: 2. cause to move back and forth;

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French rocque, from medieval Latin rocca, of unknown ultimate origin
late Old English roccian, probably from a Germanic base meaning 'remove, move'; related to Dutch rukken 'jerk, tug' and German rücken 'move'. The noun dates from the early 19th cent

sentences.cn: 当你认为自己迷路时，找一根落木或一块岩石坐下来，或者倚靠在一棵树上，列举你所记得住的事物， 以便自己的思绪能被带到可控范围之内。
sentences.en: When you think you are lost, sit down on a log, or a rock, or lean against a tree, and recite something that you have memorized, to bring your mind to a point where its under control
sentences.from: 17年12月四级真题(第二套)| 听力

sentences.cn: 路易丝湖恍如由冰山 、 岩石 、 松林、湖泊构成的一幅图画,美不胜收.
sentences.en: Lake Louise is like a beautiful picture with iceberg, rocks, pine forest and lake.

sentences.cn: 随机楔体的破坏是岩石开挖边坡中常见的破坏类型之一.
sentences.en: Random wedge failure is one of the common failure types of rock slope excavation.

sentences.cn: 这块岩石伸出来了; 遮阳蓬伸出几个脚在人行道上.
sentences.en: This rock sticks out; The awning extends several feet over the sidewalk.

sentences.cn: 这儿的石头都是火成岩,石头的裂缝极不规则.
sentences.en: The rocks here are igneous and do not fracture along predictable lines.

sentences.cn: 地下岩石移动,地面就震动起来.
sentences.en: Rocks inside the earth move and the earth shakes.

sentences.cn: 看,他在岩石后面.
sentences.en: PUPPY: There he is behind the rock.

sentences.cn: 岩石上栖息, 金台寺是珠海必须要看的文化目的地.
sentences.en: Perched on a rock, Jin Tai temple is one of Zhuhai must see cultural destination.

sentences.cn: 冰岛遍布温泉 、 美丽的五彩岩石和其他自然奇观.
sentences.en: Iceland is full of hot springs, beautifully coloured rocks, and other natural wonders.

sentences.cn: 这块岩石正在逐渐风化为泥土.
sentences.en: This rock has been breaking down gradually into soil.

sentences.cn: 因此,加强对高含水期炮眼周围岩石的破坏导致出砂的研究显得十分必要.
sentences.en: So it is very necessary to enhance research sanding due to rock destroyed around shot hole.

sentences.cn: 宇航员三次乘坐“月球流浪者”号月面车外出拍照和收集岩石.
sentences.en: The astronauts made three trips in the Lunar Rover to take pictures and collect rocks.

sentences.cn: 参天的岩石, 山麓的树木.
sentences.en: The ridgy rock, the woods that crown its steep.

sentences.cn: 夕阳之下的岩石美妙绝伦, 亦梦亦幻.
sentences.en: Absolutely fabulous sunset under the rocks, but also dream is fantasy.

sentences.cn: 炸药爆炸了,炸开了挡路的岩石.
sentences.en: The dynamite detonated and blasted away the heavy rock in the road.

sentences.cn: 韩佳: 这可不是普通的岩石.
sentences.en: No, they are not ordinary rocks.

sentences.cn: 1989年一辆拖油车撞在了阿拉斯加西北海岸的一块岩石上.
sentences.en: In 1989 an oil tanker hit a rock off the northwest coast of Alaska.

sentences.cn: 小溪中,水溢出岩石.
sentences.en: Water runs over the rocks in the stream.

sentences.cn: 据天文学家称, 那只是一块岩石.
sentences.en: According to a Cornell astronomer, it's just rock formation.

sentences.cn: 船在岩石上撞毁了.
sentences.en: The ship was wrecked on the rocks.

sentences.cn: 山谷上方的小山全是光秃秃的石头。
sentences.en: The hills above the valley are bare rock...

sentences.cn: 他虽竭尽全力,但仍然未能将那石头搬起来.
sentences.en: He failed to lift the rock in spite of all his exertions.

sentences.cn: 这儿的石头都是火成岩,石头的裂缝极不规则.
sentences.en: The rocks here are igneous and do not fracture along predictable lines.

sentences.cn: 穿过, 运用控制之歌, 移开覆盖通行处的石头.
sentences.en: Head in, and, using the Bind Song, remove the rock that's covering the passage there.

sentences.cn: 人的牙齿几乎和石头一样硬.
sentences.en: Human teeth are almost as hard as rocks.

sentences.cn: 铁锹铲在石头上发出当的一声.
sentences.en: The spade clanged when it hit the rock.

sentences.cn: 经过几个世纪,石头发生了钙化.
sentences.en: The rock calcified over the centuries.

sentences.cn: 但是小石头城仅仅是艾森豪威尔公民权利政策的冰山一角.
sentences.en: But Little Rock was just the tip of the civil rights iceberg for Eisenhower.

sentences.cn: 那些人猛一抬把那块石头搬动了.
sentences.en: With one great lift, the men moved the rock.

sentences.cn: 苔藓生在石头上.
sentences.en: Moss grows on a rock.

sentences.cn: 可是茫茫的沙滩上, 哪一颗才是绝对适合你的石头 呢 ?
sentences.en: But the vast beach, which is an absolute rock for you?

sentences.cn: 一块大石头堵住了洞口.
sentences.en: A big rock blocked the mouth of the cave.

sentences.cn: 在那只云雀再次飞回来之前,你和我若还不去搬石头,你认为可能会 怎么样 ?
sentences.en: What's the betting that you and I aren't rolling rocks before that lark comes down again?

sentences.cn: 我觉得这块石头特像鲸鱼,你们说呢?
sentences.en: This rock a whale.

sentences.cn: 这台机器能粉碎石头,可用来筑路.
sentences.en: This machine crushes the rock up so that it can be used for road building.

sentences.cn: 在这个猜拳游戏中, 人们用手做出石头 、 剪刀或布的手势.
sentences.en: In this finger play, people make rock, scissors , and paper gestures with their hands.

sentences.cn: 我用全力推那块石头.
sentences.en: I pushed the rock with all my might.

sentences.cn: 白天他和其他工人一道运[抬]石头.
sentences.en: During the daytime he carried rocks with the other workers.

sentences.cn: 他轻而易举地举起那块大石头,使我们大吃一惊.
sentences.en: The ease with which he lifted up the huge rock quite surprised us.

sentences.cn: 我踩在一条像石头一样硬的鱼上.
sentences.en: I stepped on one of those fish that looks like a rock.

sentences.cn: 嘿, 我有主意了我们可以玩石头剪子布, 输了的先进去!
sentences.en: Why don't we play Rock, Paper , Scissors , and whoever loses, goes in first.

sentences.cn: 他们碾碎这些石头用来筑路.
sentences.en: They ground this rock up for road building.

sentences.cn: 火成岩是从熔融状态(特别是通过熔化岩浆)凝固而成的 石头.
sentences.en: Igneous rock is rock formed by solidification from a molten state; especially from molten magma.

sentences.cn: 一块大石头滚了下来,差点儿砸着他.
sentences.en: A big rock rolled down and he only just escaped being hit.

sentences.cn: 如果你把所有的劲都使出来,你就能移动那块石头了.
sentences.en: If you exert all your strength you can move that rock.

sentences.cn: 水滴天天滴不停,石头最坚也磨损.
sentences.en: Water dropping day by day wears the exertest rock away.

sentences.cn: 大石头从山边滚下.
sentences.en: Big rocks were bounding down the side of the hill.

sentences.cn: 搬起石头打自己的脚.
sentences.en: Lift a rock only to drop it on one's own toes.

sentences.cn: 你在这块地行走时要小心, 地面上有许多露出来的石头.
sentences.en: Be careful when you walk in this field; there are lots of rocks cropping out.

sentences.cn: 爆炸造成很多大块的石头从天花板上落下来.
sentences.en: The explosion caused huge chunks of rock to fall from the ceiling.

sentences.cn: 鬅客摇滚乐

sentences.cn: 摇滚乐队 / 明星
sentences.en: a rock band/star

sentences.cn: 他曾告诉一位采访者，他甚至都不喜欢摇滚乐。
sentences.en: He once told an interviewer that he didn't even like rock music.

sentences.cn: 这首是RunDMC和空中铁匠摇滚乐队共同表演的歌曲《走这边》.
sentences.en: Here is RunDMC and the rock group Aerosmith performing the Aerosmith song Walk this Way.

sentences.cn: 我当然不会选择一个朋克摇滚乐手的生活方式,或者将它推荐给什么人.
sentences.en: I certainly wouldn't choose a punk rock lifestyle or suggest it to anyone else.

sentences.cn: 他非常喜欢摇滚乐,是个忠实的追随者.
sentences.en: He is very fond of rock music and is a faithful follower.

sentences.cn: 在我出现在电视, 我在一个摇滚乐队呼吁马赛.
sentences.en: Before I appeared on television, I was in a rock band called Marseille.

sentences.cn: 〔震天的摇滚乐从客厅传来,整座房子似乎都在摇动.
sentences.en: Rock music blasted from the hall and the whole building to be shaking.

sentences.cn: 病了一个礼拜后, 他更想演奏摇滚乐了.
sentences.en: Being ill for a week, he is much eager to play the hard rock.

sentences.cn: 那可是摇滚乐传奇人物你让他唱什么他就唱什么,感觉 怎样 ?
sentences.en: What's it like telling a rock legend what to sing and having him sing it?

sentences.cn: 年轻人比较喜欢摇滚乐.
sentences.en: Young people prefer rock music.

sentences.cn: 摇滚明星: 演唱摇滚乐的名人.
sentences.en: Rock star: a person famous for singing rock music.

sentences.cn: 简在当地的一个摇滚乐队打鼓.
sentences.en: Jane drums in a local rock band.

sentences.cn: 这个星期是在摇滚乐队系列的最新版本.
sentences.en: This week marks the latest release in the Rock Band series.

sentences.cn: 你喜欢摇滚乐 吗 ?
sentences.en: How did you like the rock music?

sentences.cn: 她喜欢摇滚乐.
sentences.en: She is crazy about rock and roll.

sentences.cn: 我在一个摇滚乐团做吉他手.
sentences.en: I'm a guitarist in a rock band.

sentences.cn: 到了20世纪80年代, 朋克摇滚乐已经到了全盛时期.
sentences.en: By the 80 s, punk rock had really had its heyday.

sentences.cn: 这支瑞典摇滚乐队在哪儿举行音乐会?
sentences.en: Where did the Swedish rock band give their concert?

sentences.cn: 人们一想到早期的摇滚乐准会想到普雷利斯.
sentences.en: No one thinks of early rock and roll without thinking of Elvis Presley.

sentences.cn: 她在摇滚乐迷中拥有一批热心的追随者.
sentences.en: She has a keen following among rock fans.

sentences.cn: 她立志要成为摇滚乐队的领唱.
sentences.en: She ambitions to beome a lead vocal for a rock band.

sentences.cn: 摇滚乐激起了观众的热情.
sentences.en: The rock and roll ignites the excitement of the audience.

sentences.cn: 在六十年代疯狂摇滚乐的“辩论”中,政治并非是唯一的主题.
sentences.en: Politics was not the only subject debated in the hard rock of the sixties.

sentences.cn: 自从我是一个小刚出生的孩子,我就喜爱摇滚乐.
sentences.en: HAs loved rock and roll music since I were a child.

sentences.cn: 业余爱好: 从福音音乐到摇滚乐都喜欢.
sentences.en: SECOND LOVE: Music, ranging from gospel to rock and roll.

sentences.cn: 歌迷们把摇滚乐队团团围住.
sentences.en: The fans pressed round the rock band.

sentences.cn: 我很喜欢某些摇滚乐.
sentences.en: I quite like some rock music.

sentences.cn: 在星期六晚上, 我在都市俱乐部的摇滚乐队唱歌.
sentences.en: On Saturday nights, I sing with a rock band at the City Club.

sentences.cn: 伯28:6地中的石头有蓝宝石 、 有金沙.
sentences.en: Its rocks are the source of sapphires, And its dust contains gold.

sentences.cn: 他抱着孩子轻轻摇晃。
sentences.en: He rocked the baby gently in his arms.

sentences.cn: 他的身体随着火车左右摇晃。
sentences.en: His body rocked from side to side with the train...

sentences.cn: 他站了一会儿，踮着脚跟前后摇晃。
sentences.en: He stood a few moments, rocking back and forwards on his heels...

sentences.cn: 她把婴儿抱在怀里来回摇晃.
sentences.en: She held the baby in her arms and rocked her to and fro.

sentences.cn: 然而摇晃和震动突然停止了.
sentences.en: The swaying and rocking stopped abruptly.

sentences.cn: 这只船在汹涌的海面上颠簸摇晃.
sentences.en: The boat was rocking about on the rough seas.

sentences.cn: 船撞到礁石上剧烈地摇晃起来.
sentences.en: The ship shuddered as it hit the rocks.

sentences.cn: 波涛使船摇晃.
sentences.en: The waves rocked the boat.

sentences.cn: 当风浪高船又摇晃时, 喔!求你使我镇静与有信心.
sentences.en: When the wind blows high and boat rocks, O let me have stillness and faith.

sentences.cn: 小摇篮来回摇晃.
sentences.en: Rock the cradle to and fro.

sentences.cn: 由于地震,这幢楼在摇晃.
sentences.en: The building was rocking about because of the earthquake.

sentences.cn: 她摇晃着, 开始看清了.
sentences.en: She was rocking, and beginning to see.

sentences.cn: 我们的船被波浪冲得 ( 左右 ) 摇摇晃晃.
sentences.en: Our boat was rocked ( from side to side ) on the waves.

sentences.cn: 他坐在摇椅里前后摇晃着.
sentences.en: He rocked back and forth in his rocking chair.

sentences.cn: 不要摇晃小船,否则它会翻的.
sentences.en: Don't rock the boat or it will capsize!

sentences.cn: 爆炸使房屋摇晃了起来.
sentences.en: The explosion rocked the house.

sentences.cn: 他象个坐在高脚椅里的伶俐孩子那样快活地前后摇晃起来.
sentences.en: He began rocking back and forth happily like a handsome child in a high chair.

sentences.cn: 当我走上船的一边时, 船左右摇晃.
sentences.en: When I stepped onto the side of the boat, it rocked.

sentences.cn: 船随着波浪晃摇晃着.
sentences.en: The boat was rocking on the waves.

sentences.cn: 床榻因为震动而微微摇晃著, 颇不顺畅的呼吸声不断被短暂急促的啜泣打断.
sentences.en: The bed rocked slightly movement above , and ragged breathing was punctuated by short, sharp cries.

sentences.cn: 他又摇晃起来,米切里斯站在旁边搓着手里的狗皮带.
sentences.en: He began to rock again, and Michaelis stood twisting the leash in his hand.

sentences.cn: 他们都驼背, 前后摇晃着椅子.其中有一个还在轻轻地哭泣.
sentences.en: They are hunched, rocking back and forth, one sobbing gently.

sentences.cn: 海浪的冲击摇晃着海港中的小船.
sentences.en: The impact of the waves rocked the boats in the harbor.

sentences.cn: 他轻轻地将婴儿放在他的手臂上摇晃.
sentences.en: He rocked the baby gently in his arms.

sentences.cn: 盖着破帆布的军需车摇摇晃晃地在凌乱的车辙中驶着.

sentences.cn: 玛丽随着小船颠簸的节奏摇晃着她的孩子.
sentences.en: Marie rocks her baby in rhythm with the boat.

sentences.cn: 柯罗的奶昔杯摇摇晃晃的.
sentences.en: Connor's milkshake cup was rock and rolling.

sentences.cn: 波浪使轮船簸动摇晃.
sentences.en: The waves rocked the ship.

sentences.cn: 他摇动着摇篮.
sentences.en: He rocked the cradle.

sentences.en: He was rocking himself in a rocking chair.

sentences.en: Yeah, Bay Area rocks and Oakland shakes!

Sentence.sentence: The rock salt mine is one of three operated by Cargill with the other two in Louisiana and Ohio.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Rescue efforts were underway Thursday morning for 17 miners who were stuck in an elevator below ground at Cargill rock salt mine near Lansing, New York, according to Marcia Lynch, Public Information Officer at Tompkins County’s Emergency Response Department.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: The closest that Herpin came to resting was to sit in a rocking chair and read a half dozen newspapers.
